summary: This is an email chain from August 29, 2019, between the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) New York Field Office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). The email discusses outstanding requests for records related to Jeffrey Epstein's time in custody, specifically from the suicide watch area, and includes a request for commissary records for individuals paid by several of Epstein's associates.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.role: Individual associated with funding commissary accounts
persons.context: Mentioned as a person whose payments should be tracked via commissary records request. Likely a financial associate or attorney of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email request for Epstein custody records
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sends an email to the DOJ OIG requesting specific records from the time Jeffrey Epstein was in custody, including suicide watch logs and commissary records.

locations: Southern District of New York (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The document is an internal DOJ email from August 29, 2019, concerning the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
It specifically requests staff books, companion log books, and a psych intake form from the suicide watch area for the days Epstein was there.
It requests commissary records for anyone paid by Darren Indyke, Jeffrey Schantz, Gulnora Tali, and Mariel Colon Miro, indicating an interest in financial connections to inmates.
The email suggests the after-action team may have taken the suicide watch records, indicating a post-incident review was underway.
